錜錜錜

錜字的基本解释

錜
niè
小钗，古代妇女插在鬓边的一种首饰：“华錜斜簪小鸦髻。”
小钉。

錜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［niè］
［《廣韻》尼輒切，入葉，娘。］
“镊1”的繁体字。亦作“錜1”。
(1)镊子。
(2)用镊子拔除毛发或夹取东西。
(3)指理发。参见“鑷工”、“鑷肆”。
(4)垂饰。
(5)特指缀附于簪钗的垂饰。
(6)古代织机上用以提花的部件。一说通“”，古织布机上提花用的竹针。

錜字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　錜； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1310第18
【廣韻】奴協切【集韻】諾叶切，?音捻。【玉篇】小釵。【王粲·七釋】戴明中之羽雀，雜華錜之葳蕤。【孔煒·七引】長袖隨腕而遺耀，紫錜承鬢而騁輝。　又【集韻】一曰小頭釘。

錜字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
錜字的起名意思

暂无。

Yu
Basic explanation of words
Yu
niè
Xiaochai, a kind of jewellery worn by ancient women on the sideburns: "Huaji oblique hairpin and small crow bun."
Small nails.
Yu
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［niè］
["Guangyun" Ni Noir cuts into the leaves, mother. ]
Traditional characters for "Tweezers 1". Also known as "錜1".
(1) Tweezers.
(2) Use tweezers to pluck hair or pick up things.
(3) Refers to haircuts. See "tweezers", "tweezers shop".
(4) Pendant.
(5) Especially refers to the pendant attached to the hairpin.
(6) Parts used for jacquard on ancient looms. It means "", bamboo needles used for jacquard on ancient looms.
Yu
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Xu Ji 1] [Golden Word Department] 　錜; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1310 Page 18
[Guang Yun] Slave Xie cut [Ji Yun] Noye cut, sound twist. [Jade articles] Xiaochai. [Wang Can·Seven Explanations] Deming's feather finch, the lavender of miscellaneous Chinese jade. 【Kong Wei·Qiyin】The long sleeves are left behind with the wrists, and the purple jade bears glory on the temples.　[Jiyun] One said, small head nails.
Yu
